results.name: a(n) = 3*a(n-2) + 2*a(n-3) for n > 2, a(0)=1, a(1)=0, a(2)=3.
comment: Growth of happy bug population in GCSE maths course work assignment.
The generalized (3,2)-Padovan sequence p(3,2;n). See the W. Lang link under A000931. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 25 2010
With offset 1: a(n) = -2^n*Sum_{k=0..n} k^p*q^k for p=1, q=-1/2. See also A232603 (p=2, q=-1/2), A232604 (p=3, q=-1/2). - _Stanislav Sykora_, Nov 27 2013

formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..floor(n/2)} binomial(k, n-2k)*3^k*(2/3)^(n-2k). - _Paul Barry_, Oct 16 2004
Due to the identity for the o.g.f. A(x): A(x) = x*(1+2*x)*A(x) + 1/(1+x).
(This recurrence was observed by _Gary Detlefs_ in a 08/25/10 e-mail to the author.) (End)
G.f.: Sum_{n>=0} binomial(3*n,n)*x^n / (1+x)^(3*n+3). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 03 2012
